intro: Astragalus ancyleus var. singarensis, commonly known as the Singarensis milkvetch, is a perennial legume native to Central Asia. It is characterized by its erect, branching stems and small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. The plant has palmately divided leaves with five to seven leaflets, and it produces cylindrical, hairy pods that contain several seeds. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. This species is of interest in botanical studies due to its morphological features and ecological significance in its native range.
